Class Main

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
com.example.demo.controller.Main
public class Main extends javafx.application.Application
The Main class serves as the entry point for the Sky Battle game application. It initializes the JavaFX application and manages the primary game stage.

  • Nested Class Summary

  • Field Details

    • instance

      private static Main instance
      Singleton instance of the Main class, ensuring a single instance is used throughout the application.

    • isJavaFxInitialized

      private static boolean isJavaFxInitialized
      Flag to indicate whether JavaFX is initialized. This prevents re-initialization of JavaFX components.

    • controller

      private static Controller controller
      Instance of the game Controller, responsible for managing the game logic and interactions.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Starts the JavaFX application by initializing the game stage and launching the Controller.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      stage - the primary stage for this application

    • getInstance

      public static Main getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the Main class.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance of Main
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the instance has not been initialized

    • startGame

      public static void startGame()
      Launches the JavaFX application if it has not already been initialized. This method ensures the application is started in the correct context.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method serves as the entry point of the application. It calls the launch method to start the JavaFX application.
      Parameters:
      args - the command-line arguments passed to the application
